oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Management Practices Associated with Veterinary Consultation among
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Green, Alice
Welborn, Matt
Lane, Clyde
Edmission, Darryl
Carpenter, L. Rand
Dunn, John
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: management
veterinary practice
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Tennessee beef cattle producers who consult with a veterinarian are more likely to be in compliance with or knowledgeable of certain best management practices, including practices related to judicious use of antimicrobials. In Tennessee, three-quarters of beef operations are cow-calf only. These results can be useful in tailoring client education efforts. Additionally, a valid veterinary client-patient relationship should be emphasized in promoting judicious use of antimicrobials and other practices enhancing beef production.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2008; 264
